meanings.definition: The state of remaining after something has gone or been taken away.
meanings.sent1: The remanences of the cake were all that was left after the party.
meanings.sent2: I could see the remanences of the sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The remanences of the ice cream disappeared quickly into my stomach.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the room, leaving behind sweet remanences.
meanings.sent5: The remanences of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: The act of remaining or staying in a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The remanences of the old house still lingered in the air.
meanings.sent2: The remanences of the perfume filled the room with a floral scent.
meanings.sent3: The remanences of the campfire sparked memories of summer nights.
meanings.sent4: His presence left a comforting remanence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The remanences of her smile brightened up the entire place.
